section.heading: (Formerly Sec. 19a-127f). Completion of treatment program. Dismissal of charges

content.p: The director of the treatment program shall discharge from treatment any person being treated pursuant to the provisions of section17a-696who completes the treatment program. The director of the program shall notify the Court Support Services Division of his intent to discharge such person at least seven days before the date the person is to be discharged.
At any time before the end of the period of suspension of prosecution, the Court Support Services Division may recommend to the court that the charge be dismissed if the person has
complied with all conditions set under subsection
abstained from the use of alcohol for one year if such person was alcohol dependent or abstained from the unlawful use of drugs for one year if such person was drug dependent.

Not later than one month before the end of the period of suspension of prosecution, the Court Support Services Division shall notify the court of the impending conclusion of the suspension and submit a report on whether the person has completed the treatment program and has complied with all conditions set under subsection
of section17a-696and on whether the Court Support Services Division recommends dismissal of the charge.
If the court, on motion by the person discharged from treatment, or on its own motion, finds that the person
is responding favorably to treatment at the expiration of the period of suspension of prosecution or has completed the treatment program, and

has complied with all other conditions of suspension, it may dismiss the charge for which prosecution had been suspended under the provisions of section17a-696. If the court denies the motion and terminates the suspension of prosecution, the state's attorney may proceed with prosecution of the crime.
